article.title: Raytheon to Support Air Traffic Navigation Systems
article.author: George I. Seffers
article.text: Â Raytheon Co., Marlborough, Mass., was awarded a $79,300,000 cost-plus-fixed-fee, non-option-eligible, multi-year services contract to provide technical support services to assist the Product Management Office for Air Traffic Control Systems and the Communication-Electronics Command, Logistics Readiness Center with life cycle management support for 39 air traffic navigation, integration and coordination systems and 21 fixed-base precision approach radar systems and equipment. The U.S. Army Contracting Command - Aberdeen Proving Ground, Aberdeen, Md., is the contracting activity (W15P&T-13-D-E023).
